New Records: Lautaro Martínez was the competition’s leading scorer with five goals.
The result broke Colombia’s 28-game international win streak, which dated to February 2022.
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez blasted a shot past Colombia goalie Camilo Vargas on a breakaway following a turnover in the 112th minute.
Lionel Messi was subbed out in the 66th minute with an ankle injury.
The game was delayed by more than an hour after fans rushed the stadium and tried to get inside.
Colombia played without defender Daniel Muñoz, who was sent off after a second yellow card in the semifinal against Uruguay.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina were the favorites of the tournament and never trailed during the competition.
Post-Match Reflections: The result broke Colombia’s 28-game international win streak, which dated to February 2022.
Lionel Messi has bowed out of the 2024 Paris Olympics, and the next World Cup is almost two years away.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was marred by a delay of more than an hour after fans, many of whom didn’t have tickets, rushed the stadium and tried to get inside.
A handful of people received medical treatment and asked for water in the sweltering South Florida heat.
